Body:
I'm new to FIWARE and I have started learning FIWARE IOT capabilities by running this example: https://github.com/telefonicaid/fiware-figway.

The python RegisterDevice.py of python-IDAS4 does not work. I have followed all required steps: create the token
column9: and fulfilled the config.ini with the required information
column10:
but I still get this error:

..."requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: HTTPConnectionPool(host='130.206.80.47'
column11: port=5371): Max retries exceeded 	      with url: /m2m/v2/services/OpenIoT/assets (Caused by 	      NewConnectionError(': Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 10060] Se produjo 	      un error durante el intento de conexion ya que la parte conectada no 	      respondio adecuadamente tras un periodo de tiempo
column12: o bien se produjo un 	      error en la conexion establecida ya que el host conectado no ha podido 	      responder'
column13:
))"

As this example was written in 2015 maybe something has changed in FIWARE configuration
column14:
or maybe I'm missing something....

I'm running python 2.7 in Windows 7. Thanks for any help.

"

Body:
Probably yes, although the latest commit at this github was at: 7 Jan 2016.

The problem you are facing is that the services' addresses, configured at config.ini file
column9:
have changed: 

[contextbroker]	host=130.206.80.47		[idas]	host=130.206.80.47

What can you do?

  1. Since this host has changed
column10:
you have to identify where is the new one on FIWARE Services;
  • Or you can deploy local instances of context broker and idas by yourself.

    • If you opt by 2ยบ option
column11:
you have to change the config.ini to your services's addresses (ips).

"
